title: Suddenly bad with main champ
body:
Basically what the title says, I'm suddenly really bad with my main, Thresh.
Help ;-;

replies.body: You are not alone. I think that it might have connection with the HUD. I feel that my champ moves slower than before. I am still unsure about this, but I definitely experience the same thing as you do.
wow rly the same thing for me... played vayne for years now smth strange is happening
Could be.. They're all like "IT'S ALL ABOUT CLARITY, SO WE'RE GOING TO HIDE YOUR STATS OK? COOL"
clicking the little helmet next to your champion's face keeps your stats up permanently and has more stats than before
It's not only the stats lol it's the whole thing, it's terrible!
or ... you could be cocky after so many successful tresh wins which causes you to play recklessly.

I find that when I try out a new champion, my first play is **epic** and then the next one totally sucks... really weird.

What exactly are you "bad" at all of a sudden? Can't hook/place a good lantern? Or just support in general?

Playing as a support is really half of a whole, it may not just be you. If you choose Thresh for *every* game, you're bound to have loads of bad combos (not everyone needs a hook), although unlikely there will be times where you have a massive string of terrible games.

Maybe take a bit of a break with Thresh, try something **completely** different that you're not used to - if you totally suck at it, no harm done. Change can be good from time to time.
I use to be able to read where the enemy was going and I'd hook there, but now I can't even land a hook.

I know the feeling as well.
My wukong is really good when i start rolling but know im not felling so confident playing him like my skill and mechanics with him are not the same.
But i agree on the fact that trying new champs helps alot, when you stop the losing streak and you are feeling good again you may hesitate at first when you have the chance to pick your main but when you do and it works it means you are ready to play him again

This happened to me with my Miss Fortune, when suddenly I got extremely thirsty and made all these unnecessary decisions, so I can confirm that playing other roles and other champions for awhile will help, and most importantly, playing in a good environment (friends).

A good environment helps because when you fail they help you not feel like crap and become worse, and I played other champions for a couple months until my skill in the game increased, (positioning, not being thirsty, positioning, kiting etc.) and I was ready to try out MF again.

IMO for me it was just adjusting to the level of skill of my opponents, particularly when I became lv 30, and starting to vs silvers and golds in normals xD
Take a break from the champ !! It started happening with my Rengar, i went on a losing streak so now im just trying out new champs.
same thing is happening to me with the main i just found, irelia. I will try to play some other champs atm and get back to her after a few days. see if that helps
I feel waay better with champs I play, idk

I dont know if its related but every since the bilgewater ever started I've been losing like 70% of games and getting destroyed in lane and I'm playing champs that I'm usually good with, its really weird.

Maybe you've been winning so much that you were placed with better players that better dodge your abilities.

Or you're out of practice. 

Or hidden ping increase.
